p: The majority of reads from all of the sequencing pools aligned to eukaryotic organisms, and subsequently to host nucleic acid ( Fig 2, S1 File). The most common reads from H-DBS were human derived, while the most common reads from M-DBS were derived from human and An. gambiae, indicating the likely origin of the blood meal. While host nucleic acid made up a preponderance of the sequencing libraries, reads of bacterial, viral, and parasitic origins were identified. These included two human viruses, GB-virus C (GBV-C, Family Flaviviridae) and Hepatitis B virus (HBV, Family Hepadnaviridae), P. falciparum, and multiple species of parasitic worms.
